description:
We're the Swiss kayaking group, that aims to find something out on the water for everyone, for all ages, whether new to the sport or a seasoned white water kayaker.   The group is now one season old and we're excited to see so many people interested and hope that everyone can take an active part in developing it into a great resource for people to get out kayaking.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our meetups:

We run a kayak school in Interlaken on the beautiful Lake Brienz and run a whole range of courses and tours exploring the fantastic corners of Switzerland and beyond, including many events in Zurich, giving you the foundations to develop as an independent paddler.

We then hope that with this soild foundation and safety knowledge that people can then get out and meetup together exploiting the different rental possibilities.  People are welome to use the group and when aou have the necessary experience can become an event organiser yourselves.


Organising your own tours and other free tours:

  • If you have completed the Safety & Rescue certificate (FSRT) or equivalent: You're welcome to organise events & tours on the group for others with the safety & rescue training certificate or the intro safety & rescue training, keeping in line with the basic safety principles (document to be put in "Pages" section.
  • We will also run another Taster day in Zurich in the Spring and Summer for people to meetup and try it out in a relaxed environment.  The will be a small cost to cover equipment use, which can be paid through the group
  • If you are an intermediate paddler (3star skills or equivalent) you're also welcome to organise trips with other intermediate or improver paddlers, and from time to time I also go out for paddle in more committing areas, which I will also put on the group, that people can join.
  • Rental options in Switzerland: Also to be put in the "pages" section soon

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our tours & courses:

We then cprovide the courses necessary for you to get out and start on your own. If you^d like to do a specific course and there's no date then just write us a mail and we'll put something up for you.  Our courses include:

Beginners in the Sport (first few times in a kayak)

  • Intro courses and tours around Switzerland,
  • Intro safety and rescue

Improvers (towards BCU 2star skills)

  • Sea Kayak Camps abroad,
  • White Water Intro Courses,
  • BCU (British Canoe Union) Safety & Rescue Certificate FSRT,
  • BCU personal proficiency awards - 2star kayak and open canoe skills,
  • Rolling courses

Intermediates (towards BCU 3star skills)

  • Bad weather training,
  • Rough water kayak handling,
  • Surfing Skills,
  • Improver White Water courses,
  • 3star skills training and assessment  (sea, surf and white water),
  • Leadership and coaching qualifications.

Leaders and Coaches (BCU 4 & 5star leadership and skills)

  • If you have a coaching or leadership qualification or aspire to doing one, get in touch and we can see how we can support you.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sea Kayaks & equipment for Sale::

We'll also be selling two or three of our sea kayaks this winter to make way for new boats so please get in touch if your interested.  More information to follow.
If you're also interested in getting your own kit, we recommend visiting Rene at seekajak.ch, Switzerland's specialist sea kayak store (based in Illnau Effretikon).  He really has the best kit and the widest selection and comes highly recommended.  Rene also rents equipment for those with Rescue training.

Thank you again for joining and I look forward to meeting you all soon out on the water,
Cheers,
Dave
079 906 0551
www.hightide.ch
name: Kayaking Switzerland: For paddlers and people wanting to try

description:
Toastmasters International is an educational organization organized for the purpose of helping members improve their communication, public speaking, and leadership skills. Through its thousands of member clubs, Toastmasters International offers a program of communication and leadership projects designed to help people learn the arts of speaking, listening, and thinking.

Zuriberg Toastmasters is a club within this organization meeting in the Blue Monkey restaurant (Stüssihofstatt 3, 8001 Zurich) every other Tuesday at 18:45.

You can find more details at www.zuribergtm.ch

The number of members and guests in each meeting is about 20 people, so much larger than appears on the meetup website. Come and discover for yourself!
name: Zuriberg Toastmasters Club

description: This is a group for anyone who enjoys knitting, crochet, or any other type of needle work. While having a cup of coffee or tea, we can exchange tips and tricks on our latest arts & crafts projects, or just chat... Anybody and all skill levels are welcome!
name: Knit and Purl in Wohlen AG

description: HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript are the ubiquitous tools for the web. Whether you're a web designer, a frontend engineer, a javascript developer, or a game developer looking to explore the web as a new platform. In this group we talk about HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Usability, Interaction Design and new technologies in the frontend area.
name: FrontendGeek

description:
Do you want to improve your language skills and meet new people?

Pardon Me? is for those wishing to get their language skills to the next level. People wishing to improve their English, German, Spanish or Italian conversation levels.

All nationalities are welcome, and your language level is not important - you will not be alone!

A group of open-minded internationals speaking modern languages. Language conversation practice and exchange - a great way to meet new people in the city, have a glass and a laugh and practice with native speakers and professional language teachers.

Meetups will be held in both Zurich and Pfaeffikon

topics.name: Teaching English as a Second Language

name: Pardon Me? Language Exchange - DE, EN, ES and IT

description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group

description:
Nonverbal communication is everywhere. How we communicate is a lot more important then what we say. 
This group is designed to give and share insights about how to use nonverbal communication effectively
- to become more charismatic
- to master conflicts
- to become a better communicator or Presentator
- to be seen as a confident person
- etc....
name: Body-Language and nonverbal communication

description:
Are you a diver or do you want to become one? Join this group to meet divers and wanna-be divers around Zürich. Let's get together to talk about diving, look at underwater pictures and video, get an idea where to plan your next holiday. Let's meet with people who have our same passion and exchange our experience!

Learn more about scuba diving around the world.
name: Divers in Zürich

description: This group is intended to be a community for all interested in self-realization, growth, and healing. As the great mystic G. Gurdjieff would say: "We are spiritual beings having a human experience, not human beings having a spiritual one."
name: Yoga, Meditation, and Healing Seminars

description: Do you have a curious approach to life and enjoy meeting new people? Do you like to learn, discuss, and participate in activities that support your personal growth, make you feel motivated and inspired, or simply bring a smile to your face? Then CURIOUS MINDS is a group for you. Everyone is welcome to join and to lead. So, if you have a topic you are curious about or want to organize an event, please send me an email before your spark goes away! “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” ― Eleanor Roosevelt
name: Curious Minds of Zurich

description:
This is a simple group for new people wanting to get into meditation. We will discuss brief subjects and follow a 30-40 min guided meditation. We will keep things simple, so don't be afraid to show in.

The aim of the group is to find a moment during the week to get together and dedicate 30-40 min to our self. While meditating you stop thoughts and enhance the connection with the inner you. Didn't it happened to you while walking or eating for example, you were doing something you were not conscious of? Like in automatic? Or you were completely absorbed by emotions, worries or problems? Maybe you let your self absorb completely by anger, fear?

The objective of meditation is to bring balance to your life and stop that unnecessary thoughts that doesn't let you sleep. Of course this is the first step, for the most experienced ones, meditation means an spiritual connection with all there is.


Come and join the group, even if you have no idea of what meditation is, or you are an experience practitioner, this is a moment of share and inner balance.


The Meditation session will be guided with different objectives: Balance your chakras, initiation on meditation, decision making, etc.
name: Meditation in Zurich

description: This group is designed for people who are interested in practicing Spanish language conversation skills and meeting new people. Of course, native Spanish speakers are more than welcome to join. Although meetups will be held mostly in cafes or restaurant/bars, we can also arrange meetups for other special events.
name: Grupo de Conversacion en Español de Zug

description:
Join, if you are interested in exploring the culinary delights that can be found in top notch restaurants. Think working off the *** places in the guide rouge michelin (or alike) no further than a weekend trip away from Zürich. If you are new to eating on this level of cooking-craft, don't worry about this possibly being a stiff or status driven affair. It is not. Caviar and champagne is not what this is about - and besides, you can have those everywhere in the world. This group is about is about finding and sharing the experiencing of the two spoonful of perfectly grilled fresh summer peas hidden in an otherwise splendid tasting menu that shift your perception of what you previously though possible in a kitchen. This group is about bringing together those people who do (or would) enjoy restaurant craft at the top level (more often) but lack the people around them who share this passion to do so (more often).

For the record, this group is not trying to replicate what is already very well covered by groups like

http://www.meetup.com/FOOD-AND-FRIENDS-ZURI...

http://www.meetup.com/Discover-restaurants-...

http://www.meetup.com/Dining-Out-Zurich/

but will try to go beyond what most people consider "reasonable effort" in terms of time, travel and money to achieve the indulgence.

If you consider this crazy, don't worry. It does not matter, as long as you like it.

Hence, this will never become a weekly meeting, which stands to reason if you actually are willing to travel to e.g. Alba in Piemonte over the weekend just to to have an outstanding meal. That said, there is no _need_ to travel afar if we find extraordinary places to eat closer to Zürich. Just check if one of the above zürich restaurant explorer groups might not be more fitting before making a suggestion here.

Now for the scope of what i had in mind, i have built a custom google maps entry with my suggestions, filled with some initial research into the locations, their tasting menues and ballpark pricings.

http://goo.gl/maps/zW...

I'd be happy to let people become co-organizers for meetups at these places or other top-drawer food places if you are inclined. Just let me know.
name: Zürich Gourmet Club -  The Top Notch Restaurant Explorer

description:
THIS GROUP IS NO LONGER ACTIVE 

Due to the duplication of the events with the meetup Arabs in Zurich , we have merged with that group and started organizing events mainly through them. 


I was hoping to start a meetup where Arabic speaking ladies can join the group either meetup sometimes for a playdate, family BBQ, and some other times a girly get together for us ladies to enjoy a nice meal, or a cup of tea or even a short walk!Another advantage of joining this group is supporting and helping new Arabic ladies in town, either by showing them around, explaining how things work here or even by the simplest form of support, enjoying a cup of tea with some one from back home.
name: Mediterranean Women in Zurich

description:
Are you studying Italian?

Want to refine your knowledge of the Italian language?

Or simply meet up with nice people in Zug and speak with them in Italian?

I am starting this Group to share my personal passion for the Italian language, mostly with those non-native speakers who share this passion, but to fundamentally create opportunities for some pleasant meet-up and cultural exchange.

The more, the merrier :-)

Don't you speak Italian (yet)?

Don't you worry: everybody is welcome and we'll get you up and running with the fundamentals of this beautiful  language in no time!

A presto.

Luca
name: The Zug Italian Language Meetup Group

description: “Let's get together for activities in our neighborhood, like going for walks in the park/ forest, going to the playground, the zoo, swimming pool, having picnics, meeting for a tea/ coffee and cake in the afternoon, or to go shopping and for play dates in our homes. We can also have events for just the ladies, like mums night-out, movies, dinner… and anything else that looks like fun. Ladies without children who love to be around children and would like to have some fun with the mums and babies/ toddlers are also very welcome!”

topics.name: Fun with Infants, Toddler and Preschoolers

name: Frauenfeld English-speaking mums, babies and toddlers

description: For people to get together and speak Japanese and share their experiences of Japan and Japanese culture. It doesn't matter if you are only a beginner or if you are a native speaker, it is an opportunity to meet others interested in Japan
name: Japanese Conversation 日本語会話グループ

description: Calling all Leroc/modern jive dancers in Zürich! LeRoc is an easy to learn partner dance well suited for social parties and music interpretation. Let's get together to parties and concerts near Zürich and to week-ends further away. Pasadena in Volketswil and Tanzwerk 101 in Zürich are regular venues for social dancing well suited to Leroc and other dance styles.

topics.name: Swing Dance: Lindy, Blues, Balboa, Charleston
Dance & Dancing Lessons: Salsa, Latin, Swing

name: Leroc, modern jive and other partner dancing styles, Zürich

description:
The worlds of journalists, designers and developers are coming together as reporting goes digital and Internet companies become media empires. Journalists call themselves "hacks," someone who can churn out words in any situation. Hackers use the digital equivalent of duct tape to whip out code. Designers and hacker-journalists work to bridge the two worlds.

Hacks/Hackers brings all these people together — those who are working to help people make sense of their world. It's for journalists, developers and designers exploring technologies to filter and visualize information, and for those who use technology to find and tell stories.

In the age of information overload, all their work has become even more crucial. This group aims to help members find inspiration and think in new directions, bringing together potential collaborators for projects and new ventures.

Please also check out our blog at HacksHackers.com or talk with us on Twitter at @HacksHackersZRH. Help us build the future of news and civic information!
name: Hacks/Hackers Zürich

description:
Hallo zusammen,

Nachdem es nun auch einen Treffpunkt Philosophie in Zürich gibt, freuen wir uns, wenn ihr bei unserer Gruppe dabei seit. Was machen wir? Neben Vorträgen, Kursen und Discussionsgruppen, möchten wir der PRAKTISCHEN Philosophie in Zürich mehr Raum zu geben. Es geht uns um die wesentlichen Fragen des Lebens. So spannen wir im „Treffpunkt Philosophie“ die Brücke zwischen uralten Weisheitslehren und der aktuellen Situation unserer Welt. Denn nur durch den Bezug zur Aktualität, bleibt die Philosophie einfach, praktisch und lebensnahe.

Nähere Infos zu unseren Veranstaltungen und zum Kurs "Abenteuer Philosophie" erhaltet ihr unter:

www.treffpunkt-philosophie.ch
name: Treffpunkt Philosophie

description:
The Unity 3D user group Zurich is intended to be a social experience, allowing Unity users to connect with fellow developers, either to share experiences or to inspire new collaborative partnerships.

It is designed to be accessible for all Unity users with advice for both beginners and experienced users. We're also aiming to provide inspiration for all.
name: Zurich Unity 3D User Group

description: This is a group for anyone interested in photography. From novice to expert. From nature to urban. From fasion to whatever. From locals to exotics. I am looking forward to shoot together.
name: Lucerne Photography Group

description: This is an IBM sponsored Big Data meetup group.� Geared towards developers, data scientists and ALL Big Data enthusiasts, our meetups provide an opportunity to work hands on with the solutions and tools in our Big Data portfolio. Our Meetups typically include a 45-60 min (max) presentation that serves as an introduction and overview for a specific Big Data technology.� It is followed by ~3 hours to collaborate with fellow developers and apply your Big Data skills.� We provide a cloud environment that you can run through the browser of your laptop at NO cost to you.� Our meetups are FREE. Meetup topics include: - Hadoop-based analytics - Stream Computing - Text Analytics - Visualization and Discovery tools for Big Data - Big Data App Development - Deep dives into the technologies that makes big data processing possible - Anything and everything about Big Data Join us today for a hands on software development experience.
name: Big Data Developers in Switzerland

description:
Salons are places people go to talk about ideas and issues one-step removed from politics and point scoring. They are spaces where disagreement and proper discussion are encouraged. Top speakers give up their time for free and they speak only for five to seven minutes each. Then discussion opens up. For full details and tickets:

http://www.zurichsalon.org/
name: Zurich Salon

description: A group for informal and in-depth discussion about improving the world of work and product development meeting occasionally over lunch. What will we discuss? That’s up to you. We’re all about enhancing collaboration inside organisations. You create the agenda and allow the most important themes to emerge. We’ll use the Lean Coffee format (over lunch) which means you will propose the topics for discussion. With all the topics on the table, everyone will vote to prioritise the agenda according to interest and value. We are beginners, experienced practitioners, coaches, PM office workers, product owners, managers and curious folk outside of traditional IT.
name: Lean Agile Lunch Zurich

description:
ABOUT US

Now Canada's largest tech meetups, and growing internationally, eh.

RSVP to get a nametag. This is important, because people without nametags aren't even really people. There, we said it. :) Check us out >>> Facebook | Twitter

HackerNest is an international nonprofit community movement focused on building supportive Silicon Valley like tech communities in every city - strengthening local tech ecosystems globally through unpretentious social events and hackathons. We’re nurturing cohesive communities today to empower them with more relevant and accessible peer-based tech education tomorrow.

Connecting people is awesome. And community good breeds fab karma.

We cram smart, accomplished people into a room with free beer. Our relaxed, down-to-earth Tech Socials are now Canada’s largest tech meetups.

Our membership - diverse and highly technical. Developers, designers, engineers, social media/business folk, entrepreneurs, investors, etc. regularly gather to socialize, talk tech, maybe hear speakers or watch demos, and meet future co-founders, employees, funders, and friends. Strict no-douchebag policy.

Global. We want an international network of HackerNest “splinter cells” to pop up everywhere – from underserved cities to high-growth innovation centers – to rescue nerds from isolated basements, offices, and code tunnel vision.

We love hardcore nerdcore. Tech folks, tech events, tech love. Our formula: laid back atmosphere + free drinks + brilliant people = fireworks

We're not scienticians, but the formula seems to work: we became Canada's largest tech meetups in a year, before even leaving Toronto. Today we have "splinter cells" in multiple cities internationally.

Our goal is to complement and strengthen existing nerd ecosystems – we come in peace. This isn't a business; nobody owns HackerNest. Conceptually, it is the ideal of a strong and supportive tech community - pretty much anyone that isn't a jerk can be a part of it.

Interested in running HackerNest in your city? Take a look at the FAQ.

---->---

Whoa, longest descriptions evaaar. Need more? Here's some answers. Don't forget to check us out >>> Facebook | Twitter

---->---

Here's more pictures of our Tech Socials and hackathons:

********

When: Pretty darned regularly. Check back!

Format: Relaxed. Hang, talk tech, occasionally a speaker, plot to take over the world, etc.

Where: Usually in the large private office of a tech company (have a venue?)

 

At any given HackerNest meetup, you may find people who are:

developing incredibly snazzy Ruby (most likely on Rails) applications - heady hardcore designer typesPHP/Perl/.NET/Python/django addicts - ...Fortran devs?! - looking for a tech/entrepreneur/new business story to cover - Objective-C experts and iPhone/iPad/Apple product pundits - engineers and managers and CTOs looking for co-founders to join their angel/VC-backed tech startup - looking to write articles/stories about the obscure/interesting/hilarious hacks you've pulled off - totally oblivious and just wandered in because they heard there was booze (!?) - building a top-secret app out of their basement that's going to change the way the world does X; like "Facebook for Squirrels" - scrambling to find a partner to work with on a well-paying contract that's just a wee bit too much workload for the anticipated deadline - heroes, because they're part of the burgeoning community that will reverse all this insane brain-drain - incredibly talented, smart, entrepreneurial go-getters who are absolutely dangerous to the status quo - pretty bloody interesting, because seriously, if they're coming out for drinks ON A MONDAY (or Tuesday, or Wednesday) NIGHT... they've gotta be

 

Chances are, you'll fit right in if you're a(n):

software or hardware hacker/h4ck3r (or maybe just a hack)

coder/developer/programmer/brogrammerdesigner, UX-oriented, or just like making things pretty

biotech/electrical/computer or basically any kind of engineer

network/network/system/IT administrator

front/back-end specialist

angel investor

demon investor

venture capitalist

venture communist

tech enthusiast

tech/entrepreneur-oriented media/journalist

OCD blogger/Tweeter

bloodthirsty recruiter looking to poach developers

internet mogul

nerd/geek/freak/tweak

entrepreneur

SEO/SEM pro

writer/project manager/business analyst

1337 individual

etc., etc.

...and aren't a douchebag. <3
name: HackerNest Zürich Tech Socials

description:
Hi, I'm Reena, a self-confessed foodie, and founder of Spice Lounge Supper Club, Zurich's first Supper Club for fine spicy cuisine.

I grew up in India where I learnt to cook a great variety of Indian regional food. I've also had the pleasure of preparing and enjoying popular spicy cuisines of the world from travel and living in the culinary melting pot of London for over 7 years :-)

I've lived in Zurich for over eight years and love it here, it's a wonderful place with little to complain about. However, as a lover of spicy food, eating out in Zurich has left me a little disappointed. This encouraged me to start Spice Lounge Supper Club. Naturally, Indian regional cuisine features heavily but I also love preparing authentic spice rich cuisines from many other countries.

Spice Lounge is first and foremost about authentic and delicious spicy food, but is also a great opportunity to meet new people in a small group for quality conversation while enjoying great food.

If you enjoy authentic spicy food, you should join Spice Lounge Supper Club !
name: Spice Lounge Supper Club

description: Was ist die Starter Lounge? Eine Plattform für Selbständige, Unternehmer, Ideenumsetzer und solche die es werden wollen. Ob eine neue Bio-Marmelade, vegane Hundekuchen oder eine neue Website für Immobilienmakler. Lass uns deine Ideen mit der Realität verbinden und praxisorientiert umzusetzen. Wieso ist das wichtig? Wenn dein Umfeld deine Ideen nicht versteht oder nicht weiterhelfen kann, solltest du eine Anlaufstelle haben, um neue Inputs zu holen. Die Starterlounge gibt dir das Umfeld, die es möglich wird. Gemeinsam ist es einfacher. Starter Lounge@Starbucks-Stauffacher Für den Anlass bekommen wir eine geniale Lounge: der 1. Stock im Starbucks Stauffacher. Es hat bequeme Sofas, Internetanschluss und eine gemütliches Ambiente. Das perfekte Umfeld für einen inspirierenden Abend.
name: Inspirationsabend in der StarterLounge@Starbucks Stauffacher

description:
WeD are a mixed group between 25 and 45 years old who play volleyball once a week. Are you interested? If you have played volleyball before that's even better, but not mandatory. Just drop by and have a look. During the summer time we play beach Volleyball

When/where:
Tuesday 19:30 – 21.30, indoor court 2, Sportplatz Letzi, Espenhofweg, Zürich
(Bus Nr. 72 stop Schulhaus Altweg, near Triemli).

During school holidays the indoor courts are closed and there is no volleyball
name: Volleytriemli

description:
Do you find it difficult to have a great cup of coffee in Zurich? Isn't it shame that such a wonderful city has so little to offer when it comes to high quality coffee (let alone speciality coffee!) compared to London, Berlin, New York or Tokyo. Yet, there are people who deeply care about coffee and this group aims to bring them (yes, that's you!) together.

Join this group if you have an inquisitive mind, have at least one coffee per day and want to:

  • Share your passion for coffee with like-minded people
  • Taste different varieties of coffee from all around the world (and learn what the differences are)
  • Participate in workshops teaching you how to make perfect coffee at home - Watch and share interesting presentations / movies / documentaries about coffee
  • Learn from coffee experts about different aspects of coffee production
  • Meet coffee owners / baristas / roaster and get insights about their daily work Are you interested in any of these?

This group will be a platform allowing us to talk, discuss and learn about coffee. Join us! You'll never look at coffee the same way again.
name: Coffee Club Zurich

description: This is a social group for both chinese speaking or none chinese speaking. If you love learning more about the chinese culture or want to practice your chinese or just want to meet other Chinese speaking people like yourself come and join us. Let's get together for social activities and plan great events while making new friends!
name: Chinese Social Group

description:
Hola a todos! Muchos de ustedes ya saben que Judith se fue a vivir a Berlin y me ha dejado como la actual organizadora del grupo, y quería presentarme.

En lo profesional, soy Psicologa laboral e Instructora de Hatha-Yoga, con especialización en técnicas Iyengar y en Yoga para Niños. Tengo 10 años de experiencia en la enseñanza del Yoga y estoy certificada por la Yoga Alliance International Europe como Master Yoga Teacher de 500 h. He trabajado en el area de Recursos Humanos, en donde he aplicado mis conocimientos del Yoga en las empresas, principalmente en el tema de manejo de estrés.

En mis clases de Hatha-Yoga suelo incorporar varios elementos de la metodología Iyengar. Mi objetivo es que cada uno de mis alumnos vaya avanzando a distintos niveles, sistemáticamente, pero en armonía con su ritmo personal.

A algunas de ustedes las conocí en la cena Canadiense... mujeres abiertas, con opiniones claras y que les gusta disfrutar, espero que podamos hacer crecer esa energía, junto al resto de mis alumnas y amigas en Suiza.

Seguimos con clases en horarios y lugares de práctica con buena energía y cercanos a los ya acostumbrados. Hemos mantenido los precios y hay descuentos. Si hay alguien que desea practicar y tiene problemas económicos puede conversarlo conmigo.

Horarios y lugares:

- Martes 19:30-20:45 hrs. Inicio: 28 Abril. Eggbühlstrasse 20 (Kreis 11, Oerlikon). En Español.

- Miércoles de 19:00-20:15 hrs. Inicio: 29 Abril. Zentralstrasse 140 (Kreis 3, Wiedikon). En Español y Aleman.

- Jueves 19:30-20:45 hrs. Inicio: 30 Abril. Eggbühlstrasse 20 (Kreis 11, Oerlikon). En Español.

Precios: Clase de prueba: 10 CHF. Clases regulares: 20 CHF / 17 CHF* (*Kulturlegi, *Integrationkurs Zürich, *Pago Mensual)

Consulten e inscríbanse en: yogainzurich@gmail.com

Los invitamos a venir, experimentar, disfrutar y sumarse al grupo, hasta pronto!

Natalia Zambrano

www.nataliazambrano.ch
name: Satsang Hatha Yoga

description:
We're a small (but growing) group of people (ok, for now mostly girls) practicing our sport: "swedish style" fitness. What's that ? We rent a room in Zürich and we do one hour of collective sweating, with on the program Cardio, Strength training and stretching, on fun playlists that really want to make you move ! One of us is the coach and shows movements in the middle that the other try to copy. This type of fitness is very popular in Sweden, hence the name. There is one thing with this sport though: the more, the merrier ! We'll organize meetups to motivate each other to go and get Fit ! 

This group is open to anyone with a pair of good shoes and a good mood. Male and Female ? Super Fit or Beginner ? Join us !

More info on:

Our Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/swedishfit.zurich

Our website: http://www.swedishfit.ch
name: Zurich SwedishFit group

description:
Είσαι Έλληνας γονιός και επιθυμείς να γνωρίσεις άλλους Έλληνες γονείς και παρέα για τα παιδιά σου; Τότε ας βρεθούμε κοντά στο Baden ή στη Ζυρίχη κι ας απολαύσουμε μαζί έναν καφέ ή ας κάνουμε κάποια δραστηριότητα που ευχαριστεί τα παιδιά μας! /

Are you α greek parent who grew up here or moved from Greece or elsewhere and wish to meet other greek parents and playmates for your Kids and enjoy from a simple coffee to nice fun activities? Then lets meet up near Baden or in Zurich, there are so many options really for places and enjoy! Looking forward meeting up with many of you out there!
name: Greek moms and friends in Baden, Zurich and around

description:
Calling all Naturalistas living in Switzerland! Do you or your loved ones have naturally curly hair, dreadlocks, twists, or any mix of coils & kinks? Do you often find yourself wishing for straight, easy to manage hair? Or maybe you're thinking of transitioning from chemically treated hair to your natural hair texture? If you answered yes, then this group is for you! 

This group is for anyone living in Switzerland who is interested in managing their natural kinks, curls, coils, locs & twists beautifully and affordably. I moved to Switzerland from California in 2011, and I've found it difficult to find products and professional stylists who deal with natural curly-textured hair. I decided to form this group as a way to socialize and meet with folks living in Switzerland who may have a similar problem and have had to be "creative" to manage their natural hair. My two daughters are biracial and managing their wild curls with what's available here has been an adventure:)! So, if you're not curly-haired yourself but have children who are, then please join also--you're welcome!

Although I'm based in Zurich, this group is open to all Naturalistas in Switzerland. If you're based in another city then please join and consider being an admin of the group to manage events in your city.

I'll arrange events every 3 months and we'll cover hair management topics. We can review products & styles, share ideas and support one another. We'll also have 'CurlsNightOut', our regular, fun, networking events . Join us and we look forward to meeting you at an event soon!
~Esther

topics.name: How to Maintain your Natural Hair in Winter Time
Keeping a Professional Image with Natural Hair

As it is said by Lee Iaccoca, "You can have brilliant ideas, but if you can't get them across, your ideas won't get you anywhere."

As a Meetup member there are two ways to benefit from this group:

1. You have discounts in our workshops, seminars, events, and coaching programs.

2. Becoming part of our Top Notch Toastmasters Zurich club and develop your communication and leadership skills at your own pace in a friendly and international environment.

However, to be part of our TNT Zurich Toastmasters club there are two requirements, as we are ready to give you our support to boost your skills. We expect you:

1. Speak a good level of English. Our TNT Zurich meetings are tailored to help you to develop your communication and leadership skills. It is not an environment to "practice the English language".

2. Your commitment to the TNT Zurich club by attending the meeting regularly and being supportive to the fellow members.

You are welcome to visit our TNT Zurich Club to learn more about us, our meetings, our program. A member of our TNT team will be happy to assist you.

description:
This is a group for people interested in hiking and skiing/snowboarding - mostly at a medium or high level. 

Mountains are a beautiful place to be, and to enjoy them together makes it even better! 

There are some rules:

• Please update your RSVP status, should your plans change. For an organizer it's important to know who is really joining.

• normally hikes and events will be without dogs; in case dogs are welcome, it will be explicitly written in the event description.

• if a payment is required, the payment method will be stated in the event description - or will be sent to you in a private message (in case of multi-day events).

• The activities in this group have a higher risk than sitting on the couch at home. Obviously this goes for sport activities such as skiing/snowboarding and mountain hiking, but it might go for things like for example hot wood stoves in the middle of a mountain hut, etc.. You are always responsible for assessing the risks yourself and you are always responsible for your own do’s and don’ts. You are yourself liable for the consequences of your own decisions. No insurance is provided on behalf of the organizer; please arrange a (travel) insurance yourself and make sure that it covers the appropriate risks (for example: are winter sports activities covered? This is not always the case).

description:
Zurich meditators offers a variety of meditations and teachings on how the ancient wisdom of Buddha can be applied today in this modern troubled world. 

All our classes include a simple meditation to calm our mind, followed by a teaching and a meditation to get a personal experience of the topic. 

Everyone can attend our classes, independent of age or religion, the Kadampa Meditation Center is open to anyone.

You do not need to bring anything, you can sit either on a chair or on a meditation cushion on the floor. After the class, people sit together with tea and snacks to discuss the meditation subject or just to hang out together - it is a very informal and warm hearted atmosphere.

Events: 

• Every Wednesday 19h30: Meditation classes on "Understanding the Mind"

• Once a month we hava a special event either a day or a weekend course

• Auch haben wir jede Woche Meditationen und Kurse auf Deutsch


for more information, please visit: www.kadampa.ch

or like us on facebook: www.facebook.com/KMCSchweiz


About meditaton:

The purpose of meditation is to cultivate those states of mind that are conducive to peace and well-being.

Meditation is all about the question, where can happiness be found? Happiness is a state of mind, therefore the real source of happiness lies in the mind, not in external circumstances.
If our mind is pure and peaceful we will be happy, regardless of our external conditions, but if it is impure and unpeaceful, we will never find happiness, no matter how much we try to change our external conditions.
The method to make our mind pure and peaceful is to train in meditation.
name: Zurich meditators - Buddhas wisdom for this modern

description:
This is a group for anyone into backcountry skiing, backcountry snowboarding, touring, splitboarding. You don't have to live in Zurich to join.

There's already a bunch of groups focused on beginner to intermediate skiers, or groups organizing courses such as avalanche courses or other "guide-based" activities. This group is for those who are confident enough to venture into the backcountry without a guide, and are used to being responsible for their own safety.

It is an absolute minimum that you have a working transciever (and know how to use it), shovel and probe. Do not join these meetups without this basic equipment, as you would potentially jeopardize the safety of the group. UNLESS SPECIFICALLY STATED NO ONE ORGANISING A MEETUP ON THIS GROUP IS A PROFESSIONAL. MEMBERS MUST TAKE COMPLETE RESPONSIBILTY FOR THEIR OWN SAFETY.

With that out of the way, come enjoy good snow with us! There will be both lift-based days and ski touring/splitboarding days.

Anyone can create a meetup "activity". Here are some guidelines for safe riding/skiing together:


1. Planning: Indicate in the description what kind of activity your organizing. If there's (uphill) touring involved, write a description of ascent elevation, gradient, type of terrain. It is generally a bad idea to be more than 6-8 persons in the backcountry together, if it isn't a super-easy day. Check your equipment, doble-check your transciever battery. Be environmentally conscious and share a car or take the train.

2. The day: Full transciever check at the parking lot/trailhead. Do NOT accept anyone without a working transciever and probe+shovel to join.

3. Afterwards: Drink beer!
name: Zurich backcountry skiing and snowboarding

description: Bis 2020 wird sich die globale Landschaft rund ums Gesundheitswesen dramatisch verändern. Kostendruck und Digitalisierung bringen grosse Veränderungen, die wir als Chancen begreifen. Gleichzeitig müssen wir den damit einhergehenden Risiken mit Weitsicht und Einfallsreichtum begegnen. Big data, Cloud, mobile Geräte und Tracking Systeme geben "nur" technologische Impulse. Dem gegenüber stehen fachliche, organisatorische und persönliche Bedürfnisse von Ärzten, Pflegepersonen und Patienten. Effizientes und benutzerfreundliches Prozessdesign, Kosteneffizienz, aber auch ethische Fragen müssen uns beschäftigen. Die Gruppe richtet sich an Vordenker und Kritiker, Macher und Forscher, die das neue Gesundheitswesen der Schweiz mit ihren Ideen konkret ausgestalten möchten.

description:
There is a longing inside of you for meaningful expression of your unique gifts? You ask yourself how to accomplish this in a world where the main cultural story is about competition and separation? You want to meet with other women in an atmosphere of warm-heartedness and trust?

This meetup group is for women of all ages and backgrounds. You may work in a company, free-lancer, building your own business, social entrepreneur, out of work for different reasons, at home with your children seeking new opportunities, fulltime-worker, part-time-worker, voluntary worker, student…: the more diverse the group the better. Wherever you are on your path, you are welcome.

The group is located in Zurich, Switzerland. We speak English and German.

The world faces many crises, and at the same time we are in a time of unprecedented opportunities to do what we were meant to do and finding your right work. “There is no more powerful way to initiate significant change than to convene a conversation” (Margaret Wheatley). Let’s come together and talk to each other!  

THERE IS SPACE TO:

• engage in powerful conversations about what is important for us and we really care about

• deeply listen and being listened to

• practice being grounded and calm

• co-create new ways of being and working

• develop authentic connections to other women

We will start with a meeting once a month.

The group is private, you have to register for being able to read the details about past and upcoming meetings and follow the comments and the messages on the board.

I am looking forward to talking to you!

All the best,

Regina


Regina Schlager

Wachstum in Verbundenheit,
Regina Schlager Coaching
Zürich Wipkingen (Kreis 10)

http://www.reginaschlager.eu

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Du sehnst dich danach, deine Stärken, Talente und Leidenschaften einzubringen? Du fragst dich, wie das möglich ist in einer Welt, in der wir mit den Mustern Konkurrenz und Abtrennung operieren? Du willst dich mit anderen Frauen in einer vertrauensvollen, warmherzigen Atmosphäre treffen?

Diese Meetup Gruppe ist offen für Frauen jeden Alters und Werdegangs. Sei es, dass du angestellt in einem Unternehmen arbeitest, Führungskraft bist, freiberuflich tätig bist, ein eigenes Unternehmen voll- oder nebenberuflich aufbaust, eine Unternehmerin bist, aus den unterschiedlichsten Gründen nicht erwerbstätig bist, dich zuhause um deine Kinder kümmerst und nach neuen Möglichkeiten Ausschau hältst, vollzeit arbeitend, teilzeit arbeitend, Freiwilligenarbeit leistend, in Ausbildung, Studentin...: Je vielfältiger die Gruppe, desto besser. Wo auch immer du dich gerade auf deinem Weg befindest, du bist willkommen.

Die Gruppe trifft sich in Zürich (Schweiz). Wir sprechen Englisch und Deutsch.

Unsere Zeit ist geprägt von zahlreichen Krisen in allen Lebensbereichen. Und gleichzeitig öffnen sich heute für uns nie dagewesene Möglichkeiten, das zu tun, was wir als zutiefst sinnvoll und erfüllend empfinden. „Es gibt keinen kraftvolleren Weg, wesentliche Veränderung einzuleiten, als zusammenzukommen und miteinander Gespräche zu führen“ (Margaret Wheatley). Treffen wir uns und sprechen wir miteinander!

HIER IST RAUM, UM

• uns über Themen auszutauschen, die uns wirklich am Herzen liegen

• aufmerksam und offen zuzuhören und gehört zu werden

• Ruhe und Gelassenheit zu üben

• neue Formen des Seins und Arbeitens gemeinsam in die Welt zu bringen

• authentische Beziehungen mit anderen Frauen zu pflegen

Wir beginnen mit einem Treffen pro Monat.

Die Gruppe ist privat, das heißt, dass nur Meetup-Mitglieder, die sich für die Gruppe registriert haben, Details über Treffen lesen sowie Einsicht in Kommentare und Nachrichten nehmen können.

Ich freue mich sehr darauf, mit dir ins Gespräch zu kommen!

Liebe Grüße,

Regina



Regina Schlager

Wachstum in Verbundenheit,
Regina Schlager Coaching
Zürich Wipkingen (Kreis 10)

http://www.reginaschlager.eu

description:
Für alle, die Spass an Bewegung, Tanz und Fitness haben.

Was ist Nia?

Nia ist Tanz, Fitness und Gesundheit. Dieses von wunderbarer, abwechslungsreicher Musik begleitete Bewegungskonzept verbindet östliche und westliche Tanzformen, Kampfkünste und Körpertherapie. Kurz: Nia ist ein Fitness- und Wellness-Programm, das ein breites Spektrum an Bewegungen bietet und sowohl den Körper als auch die Seele anspricht. Was es kann: Rotwangig, ausgepowert und zufrieden - Nia führt zu körperlichem und seelischem Wohlbefinden. Neben verbesserter Körperhaltung und Koordination sorgt Nia auch für mentale Balance. Da verwundert es nicht, dass regelmässiges Mittanzen bei einer Nia-Stunde eine positive Ausstrahlung und mehr Lebensfreude zur Folge hat! Für wen es ist: Bei Nia folgen alle Bewegungen dem Wohlfühlprinzip, d.h. die Intensität des Trainings passt sich den individuellen Bedürfnissen an. Wenn Du Dich gerne bewegst und gerne mal loslassen möchtest, dann wird Dir Nia ganz bestimmt gefallen! Nia ist getanzte Lebensfreude!


For everyone who enjoys moving, dance and fitness.

What is NIA?

Nia is a sensory-based movement practice that draws from martial arts, dance arts and healing arts. It empowers people of all shapes and sizes by connecting the body, mind, emotions and spirit. Classes are taken barefoot to soul-stirring music in more than 45 countries. Trainings teach people how to get in their body, learn about The Body's Way and cultivate body-centered awareness. Every experience can be adapted to individual needs and abilities. Step into your own joyful journey with Nia, and positively shape the way you feel, look, think and live.
name: NIA Zürich

poetry and metaphor and symbolic gesture are a way to communicate with spirit and learn about ourselves.

Our time together might include meditation, journeying, ritual&ceremony, myth / story / folklore, magick, herbs, movement, song, ancestors, archetypes, elements, seasons, cycles, beauty, rage... come as you are.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My personal journey to yoga:

I was never into sports and the few sports that I could stomach were pilates and cycling. As an extremely inflexible person with flat feet (they make for poor balance), I tried out yoga. It has given me a lot more than I have imagined. 

Other than the most obvious health benefits (getting active & stronger, breathing deeply, becoming more flexible), I actually developed a new relationship with my body and myself. I began to appreciate my body and what it can do and for what it does. I recognized that there are many challenging poses but learned to hold them with patience, perseverance, a positive attitude and acceptance. And I find this is the right attitude to have not just on the mat but beyond it. And most importantly, after every yoga class I feel like my mind is completely 'reset' like an electronic that has been unplugged, and plugged in again with all its problems debugged. 

So I hope through this group, I can deepen my practice, share its benefits with you, create opportunities for you to get to know yourself and to find your own peace within each moment. 

The following article touches on how I 'teach'. I am not here to show you how the perfect pose is done or to make you feel weak and demotivated when I'm backwards and twisted like a pretzel. I'm here to learn with you and show and share with you how far I've come and how far we can go together on our own journeys. If you need a lift, I will lift you up into wheel. If you need a little push I will help you stretch deeper. We will fall over together and laugh about how we'll never be able to do the split (until the day we can). And at the end of the day, I just hope to bring to you a lovely environment, time and space where you can grow and be 100% your true self all mind, body and spirit 

http://www.elephantjournal.com/2014/04/dear-yoga-teachers-please-stop-teaching-yoga-jacquelyn-richard/

So thank you for coming to the classes and all gifts we have given eachother. If you have any questions or wishes, just write me and I'd be happy to improve my classes or simply get to know you. 

I am a 200 hour Transformational Hatha Yoga certified teacher. This style is yoga is a powerful system of yogic techniques that helps us centre and balance our lives in a way that keeps us naturally happy, healthy and emotionally stable.  Based on the premise that every individual has the capacity to continuously experience pure consciousness characterised by good health, emotional balance and mental and spiritual clarity, Transformational Yoga is very quick and lasting in its positive impacts. While hatha yogic postures are practiced to strengthen the physical body, pranayama breathing techniques, mantra chanting, and meditation are also an essential part of this complete yogic system.  These techniques work simultaneously  in order to purify and energize the chakras and balance the subtle prana energies.  As a result, the effects of Transformational Yoga practice are felt immediately and are carried over into your everyday life bringing equilibrium and serenity into the physical body, emotions, mind, and soul.
name: Happy Banana Zuerich

description:
Hallo zusammen!
Wir laden Sie herzlich ein, bei unseren wöchentlichen Begegnungen im Haus der Homöopathie, Steinhauserstrasse 51, 6300 Zug, jeden Dienstag um 19h30.
Wir möchten gerne, dass Sie eine Art Yoga entdecken, welche auf Meditation basiert.
In 1970 durch Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi entwickelt. Sahaja Yoga ist eine Bewegung für inneren Frieden. Diese Meditation hilft unsere Gedanken zu beruhigen. Jenseits der Gedanken welche uns in Richtung Vergangenheit oder Zukunft ziehen, befinden wir uns in einem Zustand des intensiven Wohlseins und Friedens.
Die einfache Sahaja Meditation basiert auf der Erweckung, auf einfacher und natürlicher Weise einer spirituellen Energie in unserem Inneren namens Kundalini. Einmal aktiv, dirigiert diese Energie unser subtiles Nervensystem mit ihren Chakren oder Energiezentren. So baut sich der Stress ab und verbessert sich unsere Gesundheit. Diese Energie manifestiert sich durch das Gefühl einer kühlen Brise auf den Handflächen und unserem Kopf.
Dabei lernen wir, dass wir kein Yoga tun, sondern in den Zustand von Yoga (Verbindung= in Sanskrit) kommen, d.h. in Verbindung unseres Wesens mit dem Allgegenwärtigen.
Bei unseren Treffen ist das Hauptthema die gemeinsame Praxis der Meditation. Wir teilen auch Erfahrungen und Ratschläge unter uns aus, wie wir diesen schönen meditativen Zustand verbessern und vertiefen können.
Die Programme werden in deutscher, oder englischer Sprache durchgeführt, je nachdem, wer dabei ist.
Alle Programme sind kostenlos; für die Erweckung unserer eigenen Energie, welche unser Geburtsrecht ist, kann man nicht bezahlen!
Hello everyone!
We cordially invite you to join us in our regular free weekly meetings which take place in the Haus of Homöopathie, Steinhauserstrasse 51, 6300 Zug, every Tuesday at 19h30.
We would like to introduce you to a form of yoga which is based on meditation.
Introduced by Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi in 1970, Sahaja Yoga is a movement for peace through the spntaneous awakening. This method of meditation helps to quieten and then silence our thoughts. In the stillness we are then no longer buffeted into the past or the future by our mental activity, and can enjoy an intense inner peace.
Sahaja meditation, a simple, non-confessional technique, is based on the spontaneous and natural awakening of a spiritual energy known as Kundalini. Through simple exercises this energy becomes active and irrigates and calms our subtle system and its energy centres, the chakras, reducing stress and enhancing our well-being and enjoyment of life.
This awakening can also be felt as a cool breeze felt on the hands or the head, acting as an indicator of our spiritual qualities. We learn that Yoga (Sanskrit: Union) is not something that we do, rather, it is a state of being which we enjoy.
At our weekly meetings the main emphasis is on the collective experience of meditation, but we also take care to share our experiences and advice on how to deepen and enhance this beautiful experience, and how to share it with others.
The meetings are held in German, or English, depending on who comes on a particular evening.
All the meetings are free. The awakening of our spiritual energy is our birthright and it cannot be paid for.
name: Sahaja Yoga Meditation Zug

description:
Programming workshops for young minds, 7-17 years old. Part of the Coder Dojo network (http://coderdojo.com/about).

Young coders will experiment with various coding programs, learn from others, and share what they know with whoever is interested. The only rule is "To Be Cool!"

These workshops are free: Mentoring coders give up their Sunday afternoon, because they're passionate about their work and want to give interested children the chance to play around, and create games and apps.

Your child should bring a laptop, snack & drink, and a parent or other adult if they're 12 years old or under. Plus heaps of stamina and curiosity.

Please make sure that the laptop has a key board the child will be able to read, and a mouse it can operate. A mouse usually works better than a trackpad.

We recommend that accompanying parents bring their own laptop along, as well. You may help settle in your child for the first half hour. After that we will ask you to sit at a dedicated table for parents and try out the various programs for yourself.

This way you will be able to help other children if the mentors can't keep up with the demand for explanations and it will give your own child plenty of space to get independently creative.

!!! Follow us on Twitter: @CoderDojoZh

Though aimed at ages 7-17, this site is really for parents, mentors and others over the age of 18 to help us with events and to see how many people to expect at events. If you are under the age of 18, you may not sign up on this site or RSVP for events. Instead, ask your parent or 18+ guardian to do so for you. If you're 12 years or younger, your parent or 18+ guardian will have to accompany you during the workshops. This is in accordance with Meetup and Coder Dojo policies.
name: CoderDojo Zurich

description:
We provide an integrative experience for those wanting to embody the real possibilities of deep presence in their life and relationships. We uniquely combine Circling with Integral coaching. This is one of the most comprehensive and effective methodologies for personal growth in the world today and adds a deep structure behind the natural flow of moment to moment relating in circling.

What is Circling? Circling is a fresh way to develop presence in yourself and richer connections with those around you. It can provide fundamental and often unseen insights that once seen create new and exciting opportunities. It provides a doorway into flow experiences and breathes life into sometimes vague spiritual concepts and ideas. Through Circling individuals can start to develop trust in a deeper intelligence in themselves and others. Part of what makes it special is that although it is based on complex ideas, taking part in it is simple and empowering. We believe it to be one of the richest tools for human development in the world today because it works on so many levels.

How does it work?

Circling is a practice where the attention of a small group is skilfully focused on an individual. This person gets to feel the impact of being supportively seen by others while also experiencing their honest in-the-moment feelings. The process revolves around connection, understanding and a deep authenticity between people. It involves bringing a greater awareness and appreciation into our connections with others and can be considered a type of relational meditation because of this. It is a paradigm shifting practice that is supported by wide ranging research in how adults learn and develop. Anyone with a curiosity can come and take part in Circling because of its simplicity and practicality.

Learn more at www.CirclingEurope.com

description:
Anarchy and Capitalism: Two things we usually feel most ambivalent about. On the one hand we love anarchy (the absence of rulers) in our personal lives and would hate if someone would constantly tell us what to do and where to be all day, but on the other hand we may fear that if there was no ruler at all, chaos and mayhem would ensue.
Similarly with Capitalism (the idea that you can own and trade property without interference from a third party), we love to be able to have our own stuff without anyone else being able to claim it their own all of a sudden and tell us what to do with it, but we may also fear that if there was no state to regulate and set boundaries we may end up in a situation where there's only ruthless competition for most of the population, while a few greedy monopolists hold all the recources and destroy the environment we live in for the sake of squeezing out some more money.

But how can this be, that what is considered some of the greatest good in our lives is also considered some of the greatest evils when applied to society as a whole?

The world isn't exactly in a good place right now. National debt makes sure people are already tens of thousands in debt right when they leave the womb. Schools don't teach us how to reason and argue for ourselves or how to live up to our potential, but merely have us sit still, listen and obey a teacher so that we can repeat the same thing afterwards. There's a large and increasing number of people that are dependent on welfare, a lot of young people who have a hard time getting a job and doing something productive with their lives, while on the other side we have huge corporations that almost enitrely control certain markets without much of any competition to challenge their position.

Now, the most important thing when we have a patient with a lot of symptoms is diagnosing the correct cause or causes, as, without that, any cure is not only unhelpful, but an active waste of recources. Furhtermore, if we are convinced that we have the right cure already we stop looking for another cure.
       In the last 70 years societies and states have tried to solve all sorts of social problems, from poverty to education to healthcare with most of these problems not only not vanishing but getting worse. So I think it's only reasonable to say that whatever has been tried has at the very least not worked and should be up to question.

So this group is primarily about two things: Challenging the assumption that there is a need for a central coercive authority (i.e. a state or government) to solve social problems (like security, justice, education, healthcare, just to name a few) and having conversations and debates about the reason why the state might not only not be a solution but part the problem itself. So anyone who's intersted and curious about diagnosing and maybe finding a cure for some of the worlds ills is very welcome here.
The other thing the group is about is what we can do in our personal lives to make things better (both for us and others) and live according to the principles we value, what we can do to effectively affect change and how to face the challenge of communicating these ideas and the problems we face when arguing against the default position in society.

So I welcome everyone who's open to challenge their assumptions (and challenge mine of course) in a friendly and productive manner and also everyone who already accepts the AnCap ideals of non-aggression and wants to share their experience with living the AnCap life, talk about what we could effectively do to make the world a less violent place or just wants to hang out and enjoy some time with other AnCaps.
name: Zürich Voluntarism and Personal Growth Meetup

description:
We are a small group of musicians who play acoustic music in the American old-time style - think Appalachian string band music with fiddle, banjo, guitar, mandolin and stand-up bass. We hold a monthly jam in the Wiedikon neighborhood of Zurich and we invite you to join us to play, learn or listen. If you play one of the instruments above and you can pick up tunes easily (or already know some old-time repertoire), come to the jam session and play. We'll start slower so that you can pick up the tune. The great thing about old-time music is that we play the melody over and over again, so it's easy to join in. If you like to sing, join in on the singing songs. If you would just like to listen to an entrancing form of traditional music and have a beer, bring your friends and enjoy. This is meant to be a low-key jam session and not a stage performance.

We would like to keep the jam strictly to the old-time American style and repertoire of playing - which is a bit different than Irish music, Bluegrass or folk songs (though elements of each of these genres may appear)!  If this is something you might be interested in, we hope you'll come and find out what old-time music is all about.
name: American old-time music jam in Zurich!

description:
For everyone interested in Family & Systemic Constellations (Familienaufstellungen) workshops in Zürich!


What is a systemic configuration or constellation?

A constellation is a systemic therapeutic technique, not limited in its area of intervention. It could be used to deal with a broad range of problems: emotional issues, physical problems, relational conflicts, work-related issues, ...

A constellation gets faster to the root of an unsettled situation than classic psychotherapy does. On one hand, it brings to light the causes and hidden dynamics of a problematic situation, like an illness or an emotional issue, and shows them to the consultant... in a matter of minutes! This by itself has healing effects.

On the other hand, the work that follows is done directly on the system, allowing a deep therapeutic healing to occur, hardly achieved by traditional psychotherapy.

The current evolution of family constellation allows to work with little or even no information at all about the causes of a problem. Besides, the approach of a constellation towards a problem allows new, yet unknown, non predictable solutions to be discovered. A constellation does not look for anything specific, it just allocates a space for what is needed to be seen. To acknowledge what it is, it is a motto from Bert Hellinger, the father of constellation work, describing this idea very well.

All these factors make of constellation work a method indicated for people not finding answers in other therapies. A constellation is also intended for people approaching therapies for the first time, for those wanting to undergo a personal growing process, or who are interested in self-knowledge.


How does it work?

Each constellation takes place as a short, one-time therapy session (usually not more than 60 min.) that works with the existent dynamics and relations in a system. Its elements are represented by those participants who do not belong to the actual system.

Important systems in systemic configurations are:

• Family and its subsystems.

• Friends.

• Work colleagues.

• Partnership.

• The human body: organs, diseases and symptoms.

• The relationship with the world as a whole.

The role of the facilitator is to help to identify and solve the so-called systemic entanglements, allowing the order to be restored, with the minimum intervention possible.

In the constellation, the person who is working on a problem, has the opportunity to see himself/herself from the outside of his/her own human bonding system. This broads the chances of self-understanding enormously.


Some of the typical problems that can be worked on include:

• Health problems: chronic diseases, allergies,...

• Psychological and emotional problems, addictions.

• ADHD, learning issues.

• Relational problems: partnership, family, friends, colleagues,...

• Important decisions to be made.
name: Familienstellen - Family & Systemic Constellations

description:
Aquí encontrarás información sobre talleres en constelaciones familiares y sistémicas en Zürich, en idioma español.

¿Qué son?

Las constelaciones son una técnica terapéutica sistémica. Fascina de ellas que no están limitadas en su campo de acción. Este enfoque permite en realidad trabajar con cualquier tipo de problema, aunque a primera vista no pueda parecer imputable a un sistema.

Una de las grandes virtudes de las constelaciones a día de hoy es su flexibilidad para trabajar  conflictos en prácticamente cualquier área: mental, emocional, físico, relacional…

A nivel psicoterapéutico, las constelaciones pueden resolver asuntos en una sola sesión, que necesitarían mucho más tiempo y dedicación en otras terapias. En primer lugar, tienen la capacidad de sacar a la luz causas y dinámicas escondidas y mostrarlas al consultante en cuestión de minutos, lo que por sí mismo ya tiene un efecto sanador. En segundo lugar, el trabajo que sigue a continuación se realiza directamente en el sistema y con el sistema, lo que permite una profundidad del trabajo terapéutico difícilmente inigualable en psicoterapia individual.

La evolución de las constelaciones permite a día de hoy, trabajar con muy poca o nula información sobre las causas que producen la sintomatología asociada a un desorden. Una constelación puede llegar a mostrar aquello que no se muestra en otras terapias, ya que ésta no busca activamente, sino que destina un espacio para que lo tenga que ser mostrado aparezca. Reconocer lo que hay, es una consigna de Bert Hellinger, el padre de las constelaciones, que describe esto muy bien.

Todo este conjunto de factores hace de las constelaciones el método terapéutico ideal para aquellas personas que no están encontrando solución en otras terapias. Así pues, éstas van dirigidas a personas que quieren trabajar asuntos conflictivos de cualquier tipo, así como a aquellos interesados en profundizar en su autoconocimiento.

¿Cómo funcionan?

Una constelación es una terapia breve que trabaja con las relaciones dentro de un sistema. Para un problema concreto, revela las dinámicas existentes entre los diferentes miembros. El constelador ayuda a identificar y resolver los nudos sistémicos, permitiendo una restauración del orden perdido, de forma que el cliente, y a menudo todos los involucrados en el sistema, experimentan una mejora significativa y notable en un breve lapso de tiempo.

En la constelación, la persona que desea trabajar sobre su problema, tiene la oportunidad de verse a sí mismo desde fuera como parte de un sistema humano de vínculación. Esto amplía enormemente la posibilidad de entendimiento de él mismo.

Algunos de los problemas que se pueden trabajar son:

Problemas de salud: enfermedades crónicas, alergias,…

Problemas psicológicos y emocionales

Adicciones

Problemas infantiles: hiperactividad, TDS, problemas de aprendizaje,…

Problemas de relación: pareja, familia, amigos, compañeros,…

Decisiones importantes a tomar
name: Constelaciones Familiares y Sistémicas

description:
We bring people together who are excited or curious about games, play at work, innovation games, new ways of working, agile or game design. 

The Agile Game Lab events are an open space for everyone* interested in learning agile practices by playing or  co-creating  agile games and simulations. We meet regularly** to play, design, make, adapt and hack Agile games.

Everyone is welcome to bring your own ideas for games, issues you want to tackle by designing a game or games you want to tinker with or just try out facilitating. By playing games we are exploring new ways to deal with social complexity at work, in the safe environment of the game we turn problems into learning opportunities.  

A short history ... Stefan Haas and Stephan Schwab started the Agile Game Lab with the first event Sep 2012 at the KW Institute for Contemporary Art in Berlin. In 2013 Georg Baumgarte and Katia Vara helped to host an Agile Game Lab at Wooga which brought for the first time people from game development and agile together. More friends joined the organiser crew setting up ad-hoc game events.Now the Agile Game Lab spreads to Cologne, Hamburg, Vienna, Zurich and the world!

* everyone—neither superpowers, nor 10 years of agile experience, nor anything but an open mind is required!!

** meet regularly—current plan is to meet bi-monthly, but this  is also up to the community
name: Agile Game Lab Zürich
